# This will get executed each time the exercise gets initialized load(url("https://github.com/AaronGullickson/combined_stats/blob/master/example_datasets/movies/movies.RData?raw=true")) # create a two-way table of movie genre by movie maturity rating and save as tab tab <- # calculate the distribution of movie maturity rating conditional on genre # create a two-way table of movie genre by movie maturity rating and save as tab tab <- table(movies$Genre, movies$Rating) # calculate the distribution of movie maturity rating conditional on genre round(prop.table(tab, 1), 3) ex() %>% check_function("table") %>% check_arg('..1') %>% check_equal(incorrect_msg="It would be preferable to specify Genre as your row variable since it has more categories.", append=FALSE) test_object("tab", incorrect_msg="The contents of your tab object are not correct. Check to be sure that you are using the right variables.") ex() %>% check_function("prop.table") %>% check_arg("margin") %>% check_equal(incorrect_msg="You are running the conditional distributions the wrong direction! The rows need to add to up to 1.", append=FALSE) success_msg("Great Job!")
